item.text: The Lord spoke to Moses and Aaron:
“This is the ordinance of the law that the Lord has commanded: ‘Instruct the Israelites to bring you a red heifer without blemish, which has no defect and has never carried a yoke.

You must <st data-num="05414" class="">give</st> it <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> <st data-num="0499" class="">Eleazar</st> the <st data-num="03548" class="">priest</st> so that he can <st data-num="03318" class="">take</st> it <st data-num="0413 02351">outside</st> the <st data-num="04264" class="">camp</st>, and it must be <st data-num="07819" class="">slaughtered</st> <st data-num="06440" class="">before</st> him.<n id="1" />

<st data-num="0499" class="">Eleazar</st> the <st data-num="03548" class="">priest</st> is to <st data-num="03947" class="">take</st><n id="1" /> some of its <st data-num="01818" class="">blood</st> with his <st data-num="0676" class="">finger</st>, and <st data-num="05137" class="">sprinkle</st> some of the <st data-num="01818" class="">blood</st> <st data-num="07651" class="">seven</st> <st data-num="06471" class="">times</st><n id="2" /> in the <st data-num="0413 05227">direction</st> <st data-num="06440" class="">of the front of</st> the <st data-num="0168" class="">tent</st> of <st data-num="04150" class="">meeting</st>.

Then the <st data-num="06510" class="">heifer</st> must be <st data-num="08313" class="">burned</st><n id="1" /> in his <st data-num="05869" class="">sight</st>—its <st data-num="05785" class="">skin</st>, its <st data-num="01320" class="">flesh</st>, its <st data-num="01818" class="">blood</st>, <st data-num="05921" class="">and</st> its <st data-num="06569" class="">offal</st> is to be <st data-num="08313" class="">burned</st>.<n id="2" />

And the <st data-num="03548" class="">priest</st> must <st data-num="03947" class="">take</st> <st data-num="0730" class="">cedar</st> <st data-num="06086" class="">wood</st>, <st data-num="0231" class="">hyssop</st>,<n id="1" /> and <st data-num="08144 08438">scarlet wool</st> and <st data-num="07993" class="">throw</st> them <st data-num="0413" class="">into</st> the <st data-num="08432" class="">midst</st> of the <st data-num="08316" class="">fire</st> where the <st data-num="06510" class="">heifer</st> <st data-num="08316" class="">is burning</st>.<n id="2" />

Then the <st data-num="03548" class="">priest</st> must <st data-num="03526" class="">wash</st><n id="1" /> his <st data-num="0899" class="">clothes</st> and <st data-num="07364" class="">bathe</st> <st data-num="01320" class="">himself</st><n id="2" /> in <st data-num="04325" class="">water</st>, and <st data-num="0310" class="">afterward</st> he may <st data-num="0935" class="">come</st><n id="3" /> <st data-num="0413" class="">into</st> the <st data-num="04264" class="">camp</st>, but the <st data-num="03548" class="">priest</st> will <st data-num="02930" class="">be ceremonially unclean</st> <st data-num="05704" class="">until</st> <st data-num="06153" class="">evening</st>.
The one who burns it must wash his clothes in water and bathe himself in water. He will be ceremonially unclean until evening.

“‘Then a man who is ceremonially clean must gather up the ashes of the red heifer and put them in a ceremonially clean place outside the camp. They must be kept for the community of the Israelites for use in the water of purification—it is a purification for sin.

The one who gathers the ashes of the heifer must wash his clothes and be ceremonially unclean until evening. This will be a permanent ordinance both for the Israelites and the resident foreigner who lives among them.
“‘Whoever touches the corpse of any person will be ceremonially unclean seven days.

<st data-num="01931" class="">He</st> must <st data-num="02398" class="">purify</st> himself<n id="1" /> with water on the <st data-num="07992" class="">third</st> <st data-num="03117" class="">day</st> and on the <st data-num="07637" class="">seventh</st> <st data-num="03117" class="">day</st>, and so will <st data-num="02891" class="">be clean</st>. But <st data-num="0518" class="">if</st> he does <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="02398" class="">purify</st> himself on the <st data-num="07992" class="">third</st> <st data-num="03117" class="">day</st> and the <st data-num="07637" class="">seventh</st> <st data-num="03117" class="">day</st>, then he will <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="02891" class="">be clean</st>.

Anyone who touches the corpse of any dead person and does not purify himself defiles the tabernacle of the Lord. And that person must be cut off from Israel, because the water of purification was not sprinkled on him. He will be unclean; his uncleanness remains on him.
“‘This is the law: When a man dies in a tent, anyone who comes into the tent and all who are in the tent will be ceremonially unclean seven days.

And <st data-num="03605" class="">every</st> <st data-num="06605" class="">open</st> <st data-num="03627" class="">container</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">that</st> <st data-num="0369" class="">has no</st> <st data-num="06781" class="">covering</st> <st data-num="06616" class="">fastened</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> it is <st data-num="02931" class="">unclean</st>.
And whoever touches the body of someone killed with a sword in the open fields, or the body of someone who died of natural causes, or a human bone, or a grave, will be unclean seven days.
“‘For a ceremonially unclean person you must take some of the ashes of the heifer burnt for purification from sin and pour fresh running water over them in a vessel.

Then a <st data-num="02889" class="">ceremonially clean</st> <st data-num="0376" class="">person</st> must <st data-num="03947" class="">take</st> <st data-num="0231" class="">hyssop</st>, <st data-num="02881" class="">dip</st> it in the <st data-num="04325" class="">water</st>, and <st data-num="05137" class="">sprinkle</st> it <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> the <st data-num="0168" class="">tent</st>, <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> its <st data-num="03627" class="">furnishings</st>, and <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> the <st data-num="05315" class="">people</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">who</st> <st data-num="01961" class="">were</st> <st data-num="08033" class="">there</st>, or <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> the one who <st data-num="05060" class="">touched</st> a <st data-num="06106" class="">bone</st>, <st data-num="0176" class="">or</st> <st data-num="02491" class="">one who was killed</st>, <st data-num="0176" class="">or</st> one who <st data-num="04191" class="">died</st>, <st data-num="0176" class="">or</st> a <st data-num="06913" class="">grave</st>.

And the <st data-num="02889">clean person</st> must <st data-num="05137" class="">sprinkle</st> the <st data-num="02931" class="">unclean</st> on the <st data-num="07992" class="">third</st> <st data-num="03117" class="">day</st> and on the <st data-num="07637" class="">seventh</st> <st data-num="03117" class="">day</st>; and on the <st data-num="07637" class="">seventh</st> <st data-num="03117" class="">day</st> he must <st data-num="02398" class="">purify</st> him,<n id="1" /> and then he must <st data-num="03526" class="">wash</st> his <st data-num="0899" class="">clothes</st>, and <st data-num="07364" class="">bathe</st> in <st data-num="04325" class="">water</st>, and he will <st data-num="02891" class="">be clean</st> in the <st data-num="06153" class="">evening</st>.

But the man who is unclean and does not purify himself, that person must be cut off from among the community, because he has polluted the sanctuary of the Lord; the water of purification was not sprinkled on him, so he is unclean.

“‘So this will be a perpetual ordinance for them: The one who sprinkles the water of purification must wash his clothes, and the one who touches the water of purification will be unclean until evening.
And whatever the unclean person touches will be unclean, and the person who touches it will be unclean until evening.’”
